body.p: The undersigned respectfully states to your Excellency. That at the Feby Term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court 1864, he was fined the same of $20- for unlawful gaming.
He states that Jack Adams and Samuel Thompson were enaged in the same Game for which your petitioner was fined, and were also fined for the Offence.
He further states that the said Adams & Thompson, petitioned your Excellency a short time since and your Excellency remitted their fine Their petition is here refered too as part of this,
He states that it was the first time in life he ever was Indicted or fined for violation of law,
That he is a poor man and cannot pay the fine without a sacrifice,
Wherefore he asks your Excellency to remit the same.

F B McClary state that the above petition
contains the truth to the best of his knowledge and belief
Subscribed and sworn to before me by F B McClary this 21st June 1864.
E. T. Fish C. R. C. C
We the undersigned have examined the foregoing petition of F B McClary and believe it will be Just and right to remit the fine.

E. T. Fish
Edwin Shivel
W M. Fish
W. A. Brooks

Rockcastl Cir Ct
vs
F. B. McClary
$20-
Remit except fees & costs.
Tho E Bramlette
Gaming
23d June/64
